channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road washed away., 22nd September
item.description:
Road washed away at bottom of hill again. Half the road is missing and has been destroyed. Needs completely resurfacing ASAP. This is a ongoing problem and the slap and pat fixes are not working and cost more in the long run. A full engineered solution is needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elkstone, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road needs resurfacing., 22nd September
item.description:
Very dangerous pothole. The road needs completely resurfacing ASAP.

item.title: The shape of the pavement is throwing the excess water from the drains into our driveway., 22nd September
item.description:
When the drains are overwhelmed, the flood water that spills out floods our driveway due to the shape of the pavement, instead of the water flowing down the road. In the recent flood on Sep 20, 10 people had to spend around 6 hours to prevent the water from entering our home. We need the change in level removed to keep the flow of water in the direction of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 285, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road flooding following period of heavy rain on 20th September 2024, 22nd September
item.description:
Since the road has been resurfaced with the level raised there have been issues with water coming off the highway onto the driveways following the period of heavy rain on Friday 20th September 2024.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Suken tarmac around manhole cover needs levelling, 22nd September
item.description:

Location is opposite lamp post No.15. on the Hatherley Way, just down from the Chargrove Lane ,Cheltenham, junction. Note there is only one path on this busy road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Rain damage to cycle path, 22nd September
item.description:
The heavy rain has washed away part of the surface of the new pittville park cycle path - the rain has also created a dangerous channel which cyclists and pedestrians could trip over

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Marle Hill Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Storm water collecting in the road outside Nos 9,10,11, 12 13 Miserden Road.as drains unable to cope., 22nd September
item.description:
With heavy rainfall, esp, late afternoon of 20 Sept, water collected in front of above numbered houses as road drains unable to cope, causing back-up in domestic foul water systems with elevation of manhole cover at No 10 and perhaps other properties. Because of the hedge on the A41 side of the road, a lot of leaf litter collects, impeding water flow and also getting into drains. I am happy to be a Point of Contact as direct liaison will be helpful in enabling residents to put out cones beside drains (2 outside Nos 10 & 11) to prevent random all day parking by 'commuter' vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Miserden Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three manhole covers all lifted and pavement broken, 22nd September
item.description:
The drain outside number 270, along with two others further up the road on the same side, lifted during the heavy rain and have cracked the pavements, making them unstable for use.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 285, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rain damage to cycle path, 21st September
item.description:
The recent heavy rain has damaged the new cycle path running through pittville park. It looks like some of the reddish surface has been washed away exposing the gravel beneath. The rain has also washed away enough material creating a narrow but deep ditch in the path. This would be dangerous to pedestrians and cyclists - see photos for more details

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Marle Hill Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
